original: Portrait painting emerged as a significant art form during this period, characterized by a notable degree of innovation and change. François Baillairgé stands out as one of the pioneering artists of this generation. After studying sculpture in London and Paris, he returned to Montreal in 1781. While several artists in Lower Canada were influenced by the Rococo style, which emphasized lightness and a carefree aesthetic, Baillairgé chose
